author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body:
I've noticed a lot of people think I'm crazy and making up tinfoil hat insanity where everyone is conspiring against me.

Admittedly, I could do a better job of not coming across that way. Sometimes I state my suspicions as fact, and exaggerate them. This can end up as slanderous and to avoid that I wanted to clear some things up. So if I ended up making a false accusation about anyone, sorry about that.

No, I don't think there's a conspiracy. For example, yesterday I doubt @captainmeta4 actually woke up and said "how can I get @JosephGoebbels banned so @carpathianflorist can take his guilds?". But that is how I come across, especially during chaotic times like that. What I mean is, I feel like captainmeta4 did catch an incident but that he had a distaste for JG so it affected his decisions unknowingly. Similarly, DGK was banned for a really petty, likely accidental offense. Same thing there, I don't think captainmeta4 woke up and said "I want to get DGK banned" but I do think that the tension between them affected his decision and is why the punishment was so harsh; normally I'd expect him to have gotten a warning or a temp ban. Jason and Civil's stories are similar.

The discord mod thing, too, is the exact same way. Do the admins purposely pick out users they like and try to form an in-group? Do they try to think of all the ways they can give them extra special treatment? Of course not, but they do have a bias towards a few users for some reason and it ends up that way. They tend to pick the same people for most things, and just think that they can and should be trusted with more privileges than everyone else, ethics slipping their mind in this instance since they think it's not a big deal. When those users abuse their privileges or bend more minor rules, the admins see it differently than with anyone else; they're somewhat friends, and when someone you're friends with does something it looks more justified than it would otherwise. Likewise if someone you have a distrust for does something it seems worse than it otherwise would. I think that's what's happening here. I just think the admins are too carefree about these sorts of problems and incorrectly assert that they're not even happening, because from their perspective it seems normal. They need to be more careful about not showing favoritism or nepotism, and not giving any unnecessary extra privileges or reductions of privileges, or making biased decisions or giving preferential treatment; even if it's "not a big deal", a little leaven leavens the whole lump.

When I talk about a "cabal", I am *not* referring to any currently existing group on this site. Rather, I believe that this is the perfect setup for a cabal to develop in the future. I've seen it before; the site gets bigger, and the admins get more and more distant from the userbase because they have more work to do, while still maintaining contact with their clique. Eventually his develops into its own group completely cut off from the rest of the site, and that's when the cabal starts. That hasn't happened yet, but I think we're greatly underestimating how close we are to it. Also this cabal has nothing to do with RCP, it's mainly made up of users who are discord mods and maybe a few others like @carpathianflorist.
body_html:
I've noticed a lot of people think I'm crazy and making up tinfoil hat insanity where everyone is conspiring against me.

Admittedly, I could do a better job of not coming across that way. Sometimes I state my suspicions as fact, and exaggerate them. This can end up as slanderous and to avoid that I wanted to clear some things up. So if I ended up making a false accusation about anyone, sorry about that.

No, I don't think there's a conspiracy. For example, yesterday I doubt @captainmeta4 actually woke up and said "how can I get @JosephGoebbels banned so @carpathianflorist can take his guilds?". But that is how I come across, especially during chaotic times like that. What I mean is, I feel like captainmeta4 did catch an incident but that he had a distaste for JG so it affected his decisions unknowingly. Similarly, DGK was banned for a really petty, likely accidental offense. Same thing there, I don't think captainmeta4 woke up and said "I want to get DGK banned" but I do think that the tension between them affected his decision and is why the punishment was so harsh; normally I'd expect him to have gotten a warning or a temp ban. Jason and Civil's stories are similar.

The discord mod thing, too, is the exact same way. Do the admins purposely pick out users they like and try to form an in-group? Do they try to think of all the ways they can give them extra special treatment? Of course not, but they do have a bias towards a few users for some reason and it ends up that way. They tend to pick the same people for most things, and just think that they can and should be trusted with more privileges than everyone else, ethics slipping their mind in this instance since they think it's not a big deal. When those users abuse their privileges or bend more minor rules, the admins see it differently than with anyone else; they're somewhat friends, and when someone you're friends with does something it looks more justified than it would otherwise. Likewise if someone you have a distrust for does something it seems worse than it otherwise would. I think that's what's happening here. I just think the admins are too carefree about these sorts of problems and incorrectly assert that they're not even happening, because from their perspective it seems normal. They need to be more careful about not showing favoritism or nepotism, and not giving any unnecessary extra privileges or reductions of privileges, or making biased decisions or giving preferential treatment; even if it's "not a big deal", a little leaven leavens the whole lump.

When I talk about a "cabal", I am not referring to any currently existing group on this site. Rather, I believe that this is the perfect setup for a cabal to develop in the future. I've seen it before; the site gets bigger, and the admins get more and more distant from the userbase because they have more work to do, while still maintaining contact with their clique. Eventually his develops into its own group completely cut off from the rest of the site, and that's when the cabal starts. That hasn't happened yet, but I think we're greatly underestimating how close we are to it. Also this cabal has nothing to do with RCP, it's mainly made up of users who are discord mods and maybe a few others like @carpathianflorist.

guild.description:
The official guild for all things Ruqqus.

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

body:
Go on it yourself, they're all gone. I noticed when I was in lounge and everything stopped loading. I refreshed and all the channels were gone.

I heard from multiple users that they'd randomly been kicked too.

Edit: False alarm, you have to type `?rank member` again and it apparently undid it for me somehow. But that's still really weird, and convenient timing too. Also the mod channel deletion and the deletion of many old channels really did happen (so I thought it happened again).

Edit 2: I was right to be suspicious of the timing. They did this because too many people were "raiding", meaning expressing dissenting opinions such as this:

![](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/730807967707824259/792845754283720745/unknown.png)

body:
The reason RCP was able to know about @JosephGoebbel's ban so fast and siege all his guilds is because @captainmeta4 discussed it with the ruqqord mods in their private mod chat! So Meg was then able to tell RCP. Who knows how much more influence and special information the mods get. When this got leaked, cap *panicked* and deleted that entire mod channel and created a new one. He has a history of nuking channels when something about them gets exposed.

Supposedly this channel is for discord ban discussion and nothing else, but apparently they actually have a say in administrative decisions as well. I should also note that they also have a channel where they can see everyone's deleted messages and previous edit versions, despite not being admins, so that's a major privacy issue.

Edit: RCP probably just brigaded this thread. It was at 8 upvotes and suddenly dropped to 5 in a second.

Edit 2: Another downvote and all the other posts are getting downvote bombed too: https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/66iv/when-you-think-youve-finally-escaped

Literally several downvotes in seconds.
body_html:
The reason RCP was able to know about @JosephGoebbel's ban so fast and siege all his guilds is because @captainmeta4 discussed it with the ruqqord mods in their private mod chat! So Meg was then able to tell RCP. Who knows how much more influence and special information the mods get. When this got leaked, cap panicked and deleted that entire mod channel and created a new one. He has a history of nuking channels when something about them gets exposed.

Supposedly this channel is for discord ban discussion and nothing else, but apparently they actually have a say in administrative decisions as well. I should also note that they also have a channel where they can see everyone's deleted messages and previous edit versions, despite not being admins, so that's a major privacy issue.

Edit: RCP probably just brigaded this thread. It was at 8 upvotes and suddenly dropped to 5 in a second.

Edit 2: Another downvote and all the other posts are getting downvote bombed too: https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/66iv/when-you-think-youve-finally-escaped

![](https://i.ruqqus.com/post/66iv/ee_ubwXLfNg)

*Cabal*: n. the contrived schemes of a group of persons secretly united in a plot - also: a group engaged in such schemes.

*Powermod*: n. [short for power moderator] a person of power, usually a moderator on a structured website, that takes too many unpopulist stances

This guild is dedicated to whistleblowing and preventing powermods and the forming of a powermod oligarchy which would censor opinions and lead Ruqqus into the same corruption that is killing Reddit.

body:
Reason: spam

Of course I'm sure this is the kind of "spam" that was the reason captainmeta4 refused to approve @ExperiBass's bot: because it's stuff he personally dislikes, so that makes it "spam". You know this is starting to remind me of another site that's orange instead of porpl...

Edit: His alt account @Klenny says it was for "Epilepsy spam is not allowed". So now since the entire userbase except the admins and their discord buddies is considered schizos, I guess that makes all their content spam. Anything considered "crazy" (translation: disagrees with the admins and their discord circlejerk) is apparently now against the rules. Expect your posts to be censored and your accounts and guilds to be banned (unless you are one of their discord friends). So much for free speech.

https://ruqqus.com/+uslashremoved/post/6795/klenvastergan-permanently-suspended

The ban reason for [@Klenny](https://ruqqus.com/@Klenny) says "Epilepsy spam not allowed". So the reason this user was permabanned for "spam" was because the admins are calling all the "schizo" posting spam now. As we know, this is the entire userbase except their discord circlejerk. Since everything can now be twisted to be against the rules, expect your posts to be removed and your accounts and guilds to be banned for being "schizo". So much for free speech. +The_Cabal.

body:
I've noticed that Europeans tend to be more multi-talented, competent, and intelligent in my experience. They have a history of being more creative, for example literally all the famous artists and musicians. They tend to be more polite, more productive, and capable of learning more. For example most Europeans know 3+ languages and can speak all of them perfectly fluently, completely comfortably, whereas Americans can only speak English, and even if they learn another language they struggle to comfortably hold a conversation in it. They often can debate, do math, draw, play music, program, etc. very well more than the average American. The only thing Europeans don't have a monopoly on as far as I can tell is classic literature.

America is great and we have a better (notice I did not say good) government, more freedom, a better economy, and are the world's superpower, and without us the other countries couldn't survive. But I kinda feel like we as a whole are pretty stupid comparatively speaking. I don't think this is all laziness, because in America hard work seems to be a much bigger value, so I doubt it's any fault of our own. It's probably a genetic factor relating to our IQ that we can't control (which is very odd since most white Americans came from European ancestors, but it's what I've observed).
body_html:
I've noticed that Europeans tend to be more multi-talented, competent, and intelligent in my experience. They have a history of being more creative, for example literally all the famous artists and musicians. They tend to be more polite, more productive, and capable of learning more. For example most Europeans know 3+ languages and can speak all of them perfectly fluently, completely comfortably, whereas Americans can only speak English, and even if they learn another language they struggle to comfortably hold a conversation in it. They often can debate, do math, draw, play music, program, etc. very well more than the average American. The only thing Europeans don't have a monopoly on as far as I can tell is classic literature.

America is great and we have a better (notice I did not say good) government, more freedom, a better economy, and are the world's superpower, and without us the other countries couldn't survive. But I kinda feel like we as a whole are pretty stupid comparatively speaking. I don't think this is all laziness, because in America hard work seems to be a much bigger value, so I doubt it's any fault of our own. It's probably a genetic factor relating to our IQ that we can't control (which is very odd since most white Americans came from European ancestors, but it's what I've observed).

guild.description:
Ask and answer questions.

Rules:

🤔 Posts must be questions. This is a community dedicated to Q&A discussion, so post titles must be in the form of a question.

⁉️ No loaded questions.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

🥾 Breaking these rules will result in posts being kicked and possibly an exile.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

body:
You might think I'm spouting nonsense here but hear me out. Basically all of the Democrats and Republicans pretending they're butting heads is just an act. Their goal is to make everyone think they're divided and focus on taking one side, while in reality they both will pass the exact same things. It's clear they collude together and it's all for deep state profit.

You'll notice how most of our "political" controversies are petty arguments over religion, college campuses, lgbt, television shows, social media, BLM, etc. that have absolutely nothing to do with politics. Yet the division works, and we find people strongly taking one side or the other...as both sides pass the exact same things! All the actual political arguments, like the economy, checks and balances, rights, etc. are either secondary or completely off the table. Think about it, there's a ton of things no one ever questions and if you do you're *immediately* dismissed as a lunatic:

* The federal government is the main decision maker in every aspect of life

* Very exhaustive k-12 academic indoctrination is a requirement

* Insanely restrictive ip laws prohibit even internet memes as a huge felony (more the fault of international organizations than the US)

* The federal government is very strong and can literally do whatever it wants as long as all the politicians agree

* We blindly listen to the elites and go through the system of school, college, 9-5 job, die

* Rights are considered outdated and "collective" interests are generally viewed as more important

* The government is the true owner of all your property and even your life, as it can dictate it and you even rent your land and income from them (taxes).

* The majority always rules and everyone must conform

* Everyone must vote Democrat or Republican, and if you don't vote the same as someone else you're their enemy

* Anyone who questions the system is just an whining idiot extremist who should not be listened to

There are plenty more things, but the point is all the actual political stuff is completely unanimous: full government totalitarian control to profit the deep state. All this show of the Republicans and Democrats supposedly hating each other is just a distraction. Wake up people, your candidates' "positions" are nothing more than their personal opinions. All the politicians vote for the exact same things. The US is just a one party state: the federalist party; that disguises itself as two to keep us sheep distracted from that fact.
